intro: Cornutia pyramidata var. isthmica, commonly known as the Isthmian cornutia, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environments. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance, while its flowers are small and white, arranged in complex clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
